column1: Does the policy avoid using technical phrases or legalese that might mislead users?
column2: Is the policy written in a way most people can understand?
column3: Is the policy easy to understand without fancy words?

column1: What is the business' position on demands from the government for user data?
column2: What does the company think about giving user data to the government?
column3: What's the company's take on sharing data with the government?

column1: How does the privacy policy manage any conflicts of interest with regard to the application or exchange of data?
column2: How does the policy handle situations where there might be conflicting interests about data?
column3: How does the policy address tricky situations about data use?

column1: What information do you collect?
column2: What kind of data does it save from me?
column3: What information will you collect about me?

column1: Do users have access to their data and privacy settings?
column2: Can users see and change their own data and privacy choices?
column3: Can users look at and tweak their data and privacy options?

column1: Are there straightforward methods for users to request data access or deletion?
column2: Is it easy for users to ask for their data or ask to delete it?
column3: Can users easily get or erase their data?

column1: How does the business handle user approval and revocation of approval?
column2: How does the company ask for permission and handle taking it back?
column3: How does the company get and take back permissions?

column1: Can I opt out of sharing my information?
column2: Will I have the option of not sharing information?
column3: What information can I opt out off?

column1: Does the business reduce storage times?
column2: Does the company keep data for shorter times?
column3: Does the company hold onto data for less time?

column1: How is user data aggregated or masked to safeguard personal information?
column2: How does the company mix or hide data to keep personal details safe?
column3: How is personal data hidden or blended to protect users?

column1: Are there any limitations on how data may be processed for particular situations or purposes?
column2: Are there rules about when data can or can't be used?
column3: Are there set times or reasons for using data?

column1: How long is any data saved held for?
column2: How long will they keep my data?
column3: How long will my information be saved on your servers?

column1: Do user communications employ end-to-end encryption?
column2: Are user messages kept private from start to finish?
column3: Are user chats fully private?

column1: How are user data from being accessed without authorization prevented?
column2: How does the company stop unauthorized access to user data?
column3: How does the company stop others from sneaking into user data?

column1: How are security-related incidents or thefts of information handled and informed to users?
column2: How does the company tell users about security problems or data theft?
column3: How do users learn about security issues or lost data?

column1: What steps does this developer take to make sure my data they collected is secured?
column2: What steps does this developer take to make sure my data they collected is secured?
column3: Are there security features?

column1: Does the organization carry out privacy impact analyses?
column2: Does the company check how their actions might affect privacy?
column3: Does the company assess the privacy effects of their actions?

column1: Have any privacy-enhancing technologies, such as differential privacy, been implemented?
column2: Does the company use special tech to increase privacy?
column3: Are there cool tech tools used to boost privacy?

column1: How does the use of automated decision-making or profiling by the firm affect the privacy of its customers?
column2: How do the company's automatic decisions impact user privacy?
column3: How do automatic company choices change user privacy?

column1: What sort of analytics are integrated into the app?
column2: What kind of analytics do you employ?
column3: What analytics are included in the app?

column1: Is the privacy policy updated frequently and made available to users?
column2: Is the privacy policy updated and shown to users often?
column3: Is the privacy info refreshed and shown to users regularly?

column1: Does a procedure exist to handle user privacy complaints?
column2: How does the company handle complaints about privacy?
column3: How does the company respond to privacy concerns?

column1: Does the business release transparency reports describing interactions with law enforcement or government agencies or data requests for surveillance?
column2: Does the company share info about government or police requests?
column3: Does the company talk about data asks from police or officials?

column1: Have you had any data breaches in the last couple of years?
column2: Has this company had data breaches in the past?
column3: Has the app had any security breaches in the past?

column1: Do employees receive training on handling sensitive information and best practices for data privacy?
column2: Are the company's staff taught about keeping data private?
column3: Are company folks trained to handle data properly?

column1: How are user choices for data privacy maintained across many platforms or devices?
column2: Do user data choices work across different devices or apps?
column3: Do privacy choices work the same on all gadgets and apps?

column1: Does the company provide easy to use resources, such as tutorials or guides, to help users successfully manage their privacy settings and comprehend their data rights?
column2: Does the company give users guides to help them with privacy settings?
column3: Are there handy tips or steps for users about privacy?

column1: Do you sell my information to third parties?
column2: Is my information shared with any third parties?
column3: Does the app share any of my information with third parties?

column1: Does this policy conform with all relevant privacy laws and regulations?
column2: Does the policy follow all the important privacy rules?
column3: Is the company following the big privacy rules?

column1: What measures are made to guarantee that data processors and subprocessors respect privacy standards?
column2: How does the company make sure everyone involved respects privacy?
column3: How is everyone kept on track with privacy?

column1: Is there a procedure in place at the business for reporting and dealing with privacy violations or non-compliance issues, both internally and with third-party vendors?
column2: How does the company handle privacy mistakes, even with other companies they work with?
column3: What's the plan if there's a slip-up in privacy, even with partners?

column1: Can I delete my data?
column2: Am I able to delete the data that is stored on me?
column3: Can I delete my data from your systems and records?
